page.title: 11Woodley Town Council
page.content: {Woodley Town Council}has lots of problems to solve. Every day complaints come in. Vandalism, accidental breakage, problems big and small. Unfortunately the council has to spend more of its Â£240,000 rates on repairs rather than new things. 1973 was declared{Plant a Tree Year.}The last tree has now been destroyed. 32,000 people live in the area, 19,000 ofthese being over 18. Sheltering these people are roughly 11,000 houses with more being built. In 1956 {Woodford Park's Coronation Hall}was declared open by the famous{Douglas {Bader.}This meant many more sports facilities were available. Another Woodley problem is{Duffield Rd}where it is planned to build a footpath because of possible danger to pedestrians. It has taken 15 years for the present stage to be reached.
